snippet: Requests along the border with Mexico have more than doubled over the last three years as immigrants claim a fear of persecution back home, a federal government report found.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security reports says requests for asylum in the United States along the border with Mexico have more than doubled over the last three years; more and more immigrants are seeking legal entry, claiming a fear of persecution back home.
lead_paragraph: Requests along the border with Mexico have more than doubled over the last three years as immigrants claim a fear of persecution back home, a federal government report found.

headline.main: Report Shows Modest Rise in Requests for Asylum
